congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill, as amended, was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>H.R. 598, amended, to provide taxpayers with an annual report disclosing the cost and performance of Government programs and areas of duplication among them, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 413 yeas with none voting ``nay'', Roll No. 34;

extension.searchTitle: FEDERAL INTERN PROTECTION ACT OF 2015; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 6

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill, as amended, was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>H.R. 3231, amended, to amend title 5, United States Code, to protect unpaid interns in the Federal government from workplace harassment and discrimination, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 414 yeas with none voting ``nay'', Roll No. 35.

The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>H.R. 3231, amended, to amend title 5, United States Code, to protect unpaid interns in the Federal government from workplace harassment and discrimination, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 414 yeas with none voting ``nay'', Roll No. 35.<P/>Agreed to amend the title so as to read: ``To amend title 5, United States Code, to protect unpaid interns in the Federal Government from workplace harassment and discrimination, and for other purposes.''.
